src:
Jumlah Pengangguran di Agustus Naik Jadi 7,05 Juta Orang
05 Nov 2019, 06:26 by Danang Sugianto


Foto: Pradita Utama

Jakarta - Badan Pusat Statistik (BPS) mencatat adanya penurunan tingkat pengangguran terbuka (TPT) secara persentase pada Agustus 2019 dibandingkan Agustus 2018. Namun jika dilihat secara jumlahnya justru meningkat.Kepala BPS Suhariyanto mengatakan TPT pada Agustus 2019 sebesar 5,28%. Angka itu menurun jika dibandingkan TPT pada Agustus 2019 sebesar 5,34%."Trennya juga terus menurun selama 4 tahun terakhir," ujarnya di Gedung BPS, Jakarta, Selasa (5/11/2019).Jika dilihat angka TPT 5,28% itu setara dengan 7,05 juta orang. Angka itu lebih tinggi jika dibandingkan dengan Agustus 2018 sebesar 7,001 juta orang.Perbedaan jumlah tersebut dikarenakan metode penghitungan survei indikator tenaga kerja sedikit berbeda. Perbedaannya berada pada jumlah sampel yang disurvei."Indikator tenaga kerja surveinya Agustus 2019, jumlah sampelnya diperbesar dari 200 ribu jadi 300 ribuan," kata Suhariyanto.Selain itu faktornya pada Agustus 2019 jumlah angkatan kerja 133,56 juta orang. Naik 2,55 juta orang dibandingkan Agustus 2018. Dari angka itu sebanyak 126,51 juta orang adalah penduduk bekerja dan sebanyak 7,05 juta orang menganggur.Simak Video "NGOBS KUY! Pengangguran Digaji"[Gambas:Video 20detik](das/fdl)
text:
The number of unemployed people in August rose to 7.05 million
05 Nov 2019, 06:26 by Danang Sugianto


Photo: Pradita Utama

Jakarta - The Central Statistics Agency (BPS) recorded a decrease in the level of open unemployment (TPT) as a percentage in August 2019 compared to August 2018. But when viewed in numbers it actually increased. Head of BPS Suhariyanto said TPT in August 2019 was 5.28%. That number decreased when compared to TPT in August 2019 of 5.34%. "The trend has also continued to decline over the past 4 years," he said at the BPS Building, Jakarta, Tuesday (11/05/2019). If seen a TPT figure of 5.28% that's the equivalent of 7.05 million people. That number is higher compared to August 2018 of 7.001 million people. The difference in the number is due to the method of calculating the labor indicator survey is slightly different. The difference is in the number of samples surveyed. "The labor survey indicator is in August 2019, the number of samples is enlarged from 200 thousand to 300 thousand," Suhariyanto.In addition, the factor in August 2019 is the labor force of 133.56 million people. Up 2.55 million people compared to August 2018. Of that number 126.51 million people are working residents and 7.05 million people unemployed. Watch Video "NGOBS KUY! Unemployment Salary" [Gambas: Video 20 seconds] (das / fdl )
